page.title: 10Social Concerns
page.content: There are many social concerns apparent in Chelmsley Wood. Hooliganism and graffiti have become continuous problems for its residents. These have been accentuated by the nationwide problem of unemployment. As a result glue sniffing amongst all ages has become common and even drug abuse is widespread. The people of and around Chelmsley Wood are promoting efforts to save the Green Belt. It is also quite apparent that old age pensioners and the mentally and physically handicapped have concerned the people. Many activities are organised through church societies and social clubs. Housing is also a major concern with many flats and maisonettes being demolished and newer houses replacing them. Residents also believe that road safety should be improved.
